meanings.definition: A very large molecule, such as a protein or nucleic acid, consisting of many smaller subunits.
meanings.sent1: In biology class, we learned about macromolecules like proteins and nucleic acids.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study macromolecules to understand how they function in living organisms.
meanings.sent3: The macromolecules at the science fair were dressed up as giant proteins and nucleic acids.
meanings.sent4: Her love for science was as complex and interconnected as a web of macromolecules.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the intricate structure of macromolecules was revealed in all its glory.
